entry.title: DFPA crews fight lightning-sparked Douglas County fires
entry.summary: The Douglas Forest Protective Association (DFPA) is actively responding to a lightning storm that hit the northern part of the district on Sunday, district officials said.

entry.title: GOVERNOR KOTEK COMMEMORATES FIVE YEAR ANNIVERSARY OF FIRES
entry.summary: September 8, 2025 10:00 a.m. On the five-year anniversary of the 2020 Labor Day wildfires, Governor Tina Kotek released a statement: “The 2020 Labor Day fires were an unprecedented disaster that changed how Oregon prepares for wildfire and recovery. entry.title: Dr. Bob Dannenhoffer weighs in on how Douglas County can beat the health risks of fire season
entry.summary: Wildfires immersing the Umpqua Valley in a cloud of smoke are a near-yearly occurrence, and 2025 is no different. Currently, the over 30,000 acre Emigrant Fire is most responsible for a haze of tree line–blurring airborne particulates that are visible…

entry.title: Abundant Lightning Moved Across Umpqua National Forest AM Sep 8 KB
entry.summary: UMPQUA NATIONAL FOREST — Abundant lightning moved across the Umpqua National Forest (UNF) on Saturday, with 12 new fires confirmed Sunday.

entry.title: Roseburg City Council Considers Fireworks Ban Following Recent Fire Risks
entry.summary: Roseburg City Council will consider a fireworks ban at its Sept. 8 meeting. Fire staff cite recent local fires, rising wildfire risk, and impacts on veterans and pets. Options include drafting an ordinance this year, seeking more info, or taking no action at this time.

entry.summary: September 6, 2025 9:45 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a woman for warrants on Thursday evening. entry.title: Early Morning Lightning Storm Sparks Multiple Fires in Douglas County
entry.summary: DFPA crews are responding after 48 lightning strikes hit Douglas County early Sept. 5. Two fires have been confirmed: the 1.5-acre Fate Creek Fire near Myrtle Creek and a small tree strike on Deadman Creek Road. No homes are threatened as firefighters continue aggressive initial attack.

entry.title: Fair Time is Ag Time!
entry.summary: At the Douglas County Fair, local FFA chapters showcased the many opportunities and diverse activities the organization has to offer. While there was much success in livestock, students also created champion landscape displays and showcased their impressive shop projects.

entry.title: Remembering the 2020 Archie Creek Fire
entry.summary: The 2020 Labor Day Fires replaced Oregon on a map. Not only did the fires change how Oregon fights fires, but it changed the landscape and affected Oregonians in countless ways.
